intro: Pastinaca vanensis, commonly known as the Vanuatu carrot. It is a flowering plant native to the island of Vanuatu in the South Pacific. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other well-known species like carrots and parsley. It features a taproot that is typically orange in color, similar to traditional carrots. The plant is adapted to grow in the tropical climate of its native habitat, with small white flowers that bloom during the wet season.
